abstract: Speed with which New York State Assemblyman Carl E Heastie has emerged as favorite to succeed Sheldon Silver as Assembly speaker is raising concerns that chamber is paying lip service to genuine ethics reform; many had hoped that federal indictment of Silver would lead to debate and thorough vetting process for his successor, but Heastie seems on verge of being anointed despite questions about some of his campaign spending.
lead_paragraph: Carl E. Heastie, a lawmaker from the Bronx who has emerged as the favorite to succeed Sheldon Silver, attracted the attention of the now-defunct Moreland Commission on corruption in Albany.

byline.contributor: Susanne Craig reported from Albany, and Thomas Kaplan from New York. Reporting was contributed by Benjamin Mueller, Matt Flegenheimer and William K. Rashbaum from New York, and research by Jack Begg.
byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and THOMAS KAPLAN

snippet: Carl E. Heastie, a lawmaker from the Bronx who has emerged as the favorite to succeed Sheldon Silver, attracted the attention of the now-defunct Moreland Commission on corruption in Albany.

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Speaker Candidate Drew Ethics Panel’s Notice
headline.print_headline: Speaker Candidate Drew Ethics Panel’s Notice
